work.title: Bluescape
work.desc: Defining a multi-touch interface for an interactive, collaborative workspace
work.body1:
How do you interact with an infinite canvas?

In late 2012, Obscura Digital approached us to help them create a new way of interacting with a technology they were experimenting with. They had created a working prototype of giant, wall-sized touch screens, and imagined a new way of working, both locally and remotely, by taking advantage of the latest technologies available. They had the vision, but needed a team to help them define the details in order to make it a reality.
work.body2:
What I did

Working with a creative director and another visual designer, I contributed primarily as an interaction designer, fleshing out a whole new platform and all the interactions that came with it. We defined everything from the very basic interactions, like moving and swiping, to the more complex details, like selecting a different pen color or the handling of overlapping elements.
work.body3:
Conclusion

In the end, we delivered a system of interactions that set the basis for what became Bluescape, a collaborative workspace that allows teams to work and communicate remotely.
